subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In mainland China, the bottom component is written {{l|mul|几}} while in other regions, the bottom component is written {{l|mul|儿}} which is the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. * A {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs|CJK compatibility ideograph}} exists at U+F977 for a duplicate [[code point]] in the {{w|KS X 1001}} character set used in South Korea.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=8|rad=亠|as=07|sn=9|four=00217|canj=YRBU|ids=⿳亠口冗,⿱⿳亠口冖几(G),⿱⿳亠口冖儿(HTJK,U+F977)}}
